body.p:
To His Excellency
Beriah Magoffin Governor
of Kentucky

Your Petitioner George Gilbert would represent that he has been endicted in the Pike circuit Court for selling liquor to a miner. He states that he did sell some Liquor to a Gentleman and that a miner was in company with him and that the minor paid for the Same the adult not being able to pay for the same or not having change handy to pay for the same, He says he never has nor never did sell spiritous Liquors to a miner since the law was passed against the same; He further says that the miner or suposed miner is the Son of a widow and is a Sober discreet boy; and has been acting as an adult, and was so treated by the neighborhood as an adult nor was it Known to your petitioner at the time of the sale that he was a minor Wherefore your Petitioner Prays for a remission of sd fine and for all Proper rilief
John M. Elliott & John M. Burns say that they know most of the facts stated in the written petition are true and join in the prayer for the remission of the fine

John M Burns
John. M. Elliott
They further state that Mr. Gilbert is a orderly good citizen and a Hotel Keeper has never before been accused of a violation of his duties as such

Pike Co Cir. Ct
Geo W. Gilbert
To } Petitions
The Governo

$40 } Selling liquor to a minor
Issd. Sept 14. 1861
